programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: Butch Reynolds was one of the biggest track stars in the world, a talent in his prime on top of his sport. But when he took a drug test in Monaco in the summer of 1990, his career was upended, and his life was forever changed. Yet, then and now, the facts of the case shed more than considerable doubt on what happened ? instead revealing the tale of a man falsely accused and still compelled in many ways to fight to clear his name all these years later.

programme.title: Stanley Cup Playoff
programme.sub-title: Game 6: Winnipeg Jets at Dallas Stars
programme.desc: Winnipeg Jets at Dallas Stars in Game 6 of a Western Conference second-round series. From American Airlines Center. The Stars return to Texas still one win away from a conference finals rematch with Edmonton, having been blanked by Connor Hellebuyck in their last two games on Jets ice. Stars winger Mikko Rantanen remains the NHL playoff scoring leader with 19 points and nine goals. Winnipeg is mired in a nine-game road losing streak in the playoffs.

programme.title: Stanley Cup Playoff
programme.sub-title: Game 7: St. Louis Blues vs. Winnipeg Jets
programme.desc: St. Louis Blues vs. Winnipeg Jets in Game 7 of a Western Conference first-round series. From Canada Life Centre. The first-ever NHL Game 7 in Manitoba will send one of these teams into the second round, following six straights wins by the home team. St. Louis knotted the series with a 5-2 triumph two nights ago in which they chased Jets star goalie Connor Hellebuyck after two periods.

programme.title: Stanley Cup Playoff
programme.sub-title: Game 3: Carolina Hurricanes vs. New Jersey Devils
programme.desc: Carolina Hurricanes vs. New Jersey Devils in Game 3 of an Eastern Conference first-round series. From Prudential Center. The 'Canes blow into Newark with a 2-0 series lead, built on two stellar performances by goaltender Frederik Andersen (1.00 GAA), as well as Jordan Martinook's electric shorthanded game-winning goal midway through Game 2. Carolina is 5-13 on the road the last three postseasons, with this series the sixth in that span against a team in the New York metro area.

programme.title: Stanley Cup Playoff
programme.sub-title: Game 5: New Jersey Devils vs. Carolina Hurricanes
programme.desc: New Jersey Devils vs. Carolina Hurricanes in Game 5 of an Eastern Conference first-round series. From Lenovo Center. Seventh-year forward Andrei Svechnikov came alive with a hat trick in Game 4 as Carolina took a 3-1 series lead and now looks to extend its first-round home dominance under Rod Brind'Amour. Pyotr Kochetkov saw his first action in net for the Canes in relief of ailing Fred Andersen.

programme.desc: From 2007: Cleveland at Detroit in Game 5 of the Eastern Conference finals. The Cavs won 109-107 in double overtime, behind LeBron James' 48 points, which included Cleveland's last 25 points and 29 of the team's final 30 points.

programme.desc: 2025: Phoenix Suns at Denver Nuggets.

programme.title: NBA Playoff
programme.sub-title: Game 1: Detroit Pistons at New York Knicks
programme.desc: Detroit Pistons at New York Knicks in Game 1 of an Eastern Conference first-round series. From Madison Square Garden. Fourth-year star Cade Cunningham heads the Pistons' first playoff squad in six years, and averaged 30.8 points and 8.3 assists vs. New York this season as Detroit went 2-0 at MSG. Jalen Brunson and Karl-Anthony Towns pace the Knicks in the teams' first playoff meeting since 1992.

programme.title: NBA Playoff
programme.sub-title: Game 2: Detroit Pistons at New York Knicks
programme.desc: Detroit Pistons at New York Knicks in Game 2 of an Eastern Conference first-round series. From Madison Square Garden. The Pistons try again to end their 15-game playoff losing streak after falling 123-112 in Game 1 in the Big Apple, crumbling by 40-21 in the fourth quarter. Jalen Brunson's 34 led New York, while Karl-Anthony Towns and OG Anunoby combined for nine steals, four blocks and 46 points.

programme.title: NBA Playoff
programme.sub-title: Game 3: New York Knicks at Detroit Pistons
programme.desc: New York Knicks at Detroit Pistons in Game 3 of an Eastern Conference first-round series. From Little Caesars Arena. J.B. Bickerstaff's Pistons return to the Motor City as playoff winners for the first time in 17 years following a 100-94 triumph in Game 2 that knotted the series at 1-1. Cade Cunningham piled up 33 points and 12 boards in the win, while Jalen Brunson's 37 went for naught.

programme.sub-title: Game 4: New York Knicks at Detroit Pistons
programme.desc: New York Knicks at Detroit Pistons in Game 4 of an Eastern Conference first-round series. From Little Caesars Arena. J.B. Bickerstaff's Pistons trail 2-1 in the series and are a loss away from matching the league record of nine for consecutive home playoff losses, set by the 76ers (1968-71). Karl-Anthony Towns (31 points) and Jalen Brunson (30) carried New York in a 118-116 Game 3 victory.

programme.title: NBA Playoff
programme.sub-title: Game 6: New York Knicks at Detroit Pistons
programme.desc: New York Knicks at Detroit Pistons in Game 6 of an Eastern Conference first-round series. From Little Caesars Arena. The visitors have won four of five games in this series as New York takes a 3-2 edge back to Motown, where the Pistons have lost an NBA record-tying nine straight playoff games. Third-year center Jalen Duren had nine points, 14 boards and six assists in Detroit's 106-103 Game 5 win.

programme.title: NBA Playoff
programme.sub-title: Game 1: Los Angeles Clippers at Denver Nuggets
programme.desc: Los Angeles Clippers at Denver Nuggets in Game 1 of a Western Conference first-round series. From Ball Arena. Ty Lue's Clippers sail into the playoffs on an eight-game win streak, boasting the third-best FG pct. defense (39.5) in the league as they battle superstar Nikola Jokic, the third player ever to average a triple-double for an NBA season. Fellow Euro Ivica Zubac patrols the paint for L.A.

programme.title: NBA Playoff
programme.sub-title: Game 2: Los Angeles Clippers at Denver Nuggets
programme.desc: Los Angeles Clippers at Denver Nuggets in Game 2 of a Western Conference first-round series. From Ball Arena. Denver's Russell Westbrook stung his previous Clippers mates with late clutch play in a 112-110 Game 1 overtime win. Nikola Jokic chipped in three of the Nuggets' 11 steals, to go with a game-high 29 points and 12 assists. James Harden's 32 points topped L.A., which blew a 15-point lead.

programme.desc: From 1976: Denver Nuggets at New York Nets in Game 6 of the last ABA Finals. League and playoffs MVP Julius Erving led the Nets against fellow high-flyer David Thompson and the Nuggets.

programme.title: NBA Playoff
programme.sub-title: Game 2: Los Angeles Clippers at Denver Nuggets
programme.desc: Los Angeles Clippers at Denver Nuggets in Game 2 of a Western Conference first-round series. From Ball Arena. Denver's Russell Westbrook stung his previous Clippers mates with late clutch play in a 112-110 Game 1 overtime win. Nikola Jokic chipped in three of the Nuggets' 11 steals, to go with a game-high 29 points and 12 assists. James Harden's 32 points topped L.A., which blew a 15-point lead.

programme.title: NBA Playoff
programme.sub-title: Game 4: Denver Nuggets at Los Angeles Clippers
programme.desc: Denver Nuggets at Los Angeles Clippers in Game 4 of a Western Conference first-round series. From Intuit Dome. L.A. is up 2-1 in a best-of-seven that began with two nail-biting finishes in Denver before the Clippers sailed to a 117-83 Game 3 win in their raucous new home in Inglewood. Nic Batum had four of L.A.'s 18 made three-pointers, to just seven for the Nuggets.

programme.title: NBA Playoff
programme.sub-title: Game 4: Houston Rockets at Golden State Warriors
programme.desc: Houston Rockets at Golden State Warriors in Game 4 of a Western Conference first-round series. From Chase Center. Steve Kerr's Warriors are up 2-1, halfway to their eighth first-round series win in the last eight tries. Steph Curry's 36 points and nine assists fueled a 104-93 win in Game 3 as Golden State weathered an early 13-point Rockets lead, and overcame 31-percent shooting from long range.

programme.title: NBA Playoff
programme.sub-title: Game 5: Golden State Warriors at Houston Rockets
programme.desc: Golden State Warriors at Houston Rockets in Game 5 of a Western Conference first-round series. From Toyota Center. Steve Kerr's Warriors return to Texas with a 3-1 series edge, looking to close out the young Rockets who fell 109-106 in Game 4 despite eight threes from Fred VanVleet. Jimmy Butler's 27 points sparked Golden State in his return from injury, sinking 12-of-12 free throws.

programme.title: NBA Playoff
programme.sub-title: Game 6: Houston Rockets at Golden State Warriors
programme.desc: Houston Rockets at Golden State Warriors in Game 6 of a Western Conference first-round series. From Chase Center. Steph Curry and the veteran Dubs take a second shot at closing out youthful Houston, which held serve in Game 5 with a 131-116 home win sparked by Amen Thompson's 25 points and five steals. Golden State's starters totaled just 40 points as the Rockets built a lead as big as 31.

programme.title: NBA Playoff
programme.sub-title: Game 1: Minnesota Timberwolves at Los Angeles Lakers
programme.desc: Minnesota Timberwolves at Los Angeles Lakers in Game 1 of a Western Conference first-round series. From Crypto.com Arena. Now wearing Lakers gold, Luke Doncic tries to oust Anthony Edwards and Minnesota for a second straight postseason after willing Dallas to a 4-1 win in the 2024 West finals. Twenty years earlier was the T-Wolves' last playoff meeting with the Lakers, a 4-2 West finals loss.

programme.title: NBA Playoff
programme.sub-title: Game 2: Minnesota Timberwolves at Los Angeles Lakers
programme.desc: Minnesota Timberwolves at Los Angeles Lakers in Game 2 of a Western Conference first-round series. From Crypto.com Arena. Anthony Edwards and the T-Wolves try to replicate their fine form from a 117-95 win in Game 1, the Lakers' first at home since 2012. Minnesota shot 21-for-42 from long range, including six threes from Naz Reid. Newest Laker Luka Doncic tallied 37 in defeat.

programme.title: NBA Playoff
programme.sub-title: Game 3: Los Angeles Lakers at Minnesota Timberwolves
programme.desc: Los Angeles Lakers at Minnesota Timberwolves in Game 3 of a Western Conference first-round series. From Target Center. Luka Doncic (31 points, 12 boards, 9 assists) and the Lakers clawed past the T-Wolves 94-85 in Game 2 to send the series north tied 1-1. This is the same court where Doncic (with Dallas) ended Minnesota's season last May with three road wins in the Western Conference finals.

programme.title: IndyCar Racing
programme.desc: The 109th Running of the Indianapolis 500. From Indianapolis Motor Speedway. Robert Shwartzman is the first rookie in 43 years to start on pole, with two-time champ Takuma Sato and Pato O'Ward for company on Row 1. Kyle Larson starts 19th in his bid to become the fifth driver to complete this race and NASCAR's Coca-Cola 600 in Charlotte on the same day. Defending champ Josef Newgarden is in Row 11 alongside Penske Racing teammate Will Power after their cars were found with illegal modifications.
